scene_name: Full Scene - Raise Arm light and lower
Left Arm Trial with Sound (two moves)

steps.name: Jims Lament
steps.text:
The Devil's Detective
In Iowa's cornfields, dark and deep,
Where shadows dance and secrets keep,
Jim Sherlock walked one autumn night,
When something gave him quite a fright.
The Devil stood beside a tree,
And spoke these words so terribly:
"Venite mecum, detective,
Nox est longa, et sum active!"
(Come with me, detective dear,
The night is long, and I am here!)
Jim Sherlock tipped his famous hat,
And said, "Now what's the trick in that?
I've solved a hundred cases true,
But never one that came from you!"
The Devil laughed with fiery breath,
His laughter cold as winter's death.
Through Iowa's maze of swaying corn,
They played their game till early morn.
With logic sharp and wit so keen,
Jim Sherlock solved what must be seen.
The Devil's puzzles, one by one,
Until the rising of the sun.
"Admirabile mysterium!"
The Devil cried, his voice now glum.
"No mortal's ever beat my game!"
And vanished in a burst of flame.
So if you're walking late at night,
Through Iowa's fields in pale moonlight,
Remember Sherlock's clever tale—
The night the Devil's tricks did fail.
But listen close, and you might hear
The Devil whisper in your ear:
"Redibo iterum aliquando..."

steps.name: Cold
steps.text: If you think it's cold in hell, check Coralville out!

steps.name: Happy
steps.text: Don't Forget to Vote! I'm watching....closely....with anticipation.....

steps.name: Halleleusay
steps.text:
In the desert

I saw a creature, naked, bestial,

Who, squatting upon the ground,

Held his heart in his hands,

And ate of it.

I said, “Is it good, friend?”

“It is bitter—bitter,” he answered;

“But I like it

“Because it is bitter,

“And because it is my heart.”

steps.name: Poem IA
steps.text:
Listen up, Iowa kiddies so sweet,
I'm the Devil, here for souls to reap!
Your cornfields hide secrets deep inside,
Where shadow-things slither and glide!

The scarecrows now hunt through the night,
Farm dogs howl in pure fright,
The grain bins rattle with ghostly bones,
While windmills creak with dying moans!

But don't you worry, don't you run,
This harvest night has just begun!
For when the moon turns blood-red here,
All of Iowa will disappear...

steps.name: Latin
steps.text:
Audite, dulces pueri Iovenses,
Diabolus sum, animas collecturus!
Agri vestri secreta alta celant,
Ubi umbrae serpunt et vagantur!

Formidines nunc nocte venantur,
Canes rustici terrore ululant,
Granaria ossibus spectralibus crepitant,
Dum molae ventorum gemitibus morientibus strident!

Sed nolite timere, nolite fugere,
Haec nox messis modo incipit!
Nam cum luna sanguinea hic fit,
Tota Iova evanescet...
*risus diabolicus*
